newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria sells two hotels in Black Sea resorts.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria sells two hotels in Black Sea resorts.

text.p: Bulgaria's Privatisation Agency said on Friday it had sold two hotels in the Black Sea resorts of Zlatni Pyasatsi and Slanchev Bryag for a total of 155.966 million levs.
Under the deals the Bulgarian buyers will have to invest some 175 million levs in the hotels.
The Privatisation Agency has sold another 14 hotels and restaurants in the two purpose-built holiday complexes since August 15 for some 376 million levs, Privatisation Agency's official data show.
Though state-owned, Bulgarian resorts are not subsidised by the state and have to rely solely on revenues to upgrade their facilities.
Germans and Russians top the list of foreign visitors to Bulgaria's seaside holiday complexes, followed by Britons and Scandinavians.

The agency also said it had sold Madara Intertour tourist company based in the northern town of Shoumen for 406 million levs to a Bulgarian buyer. The new owner will have to invest some 80 million levs under the contract.
The firm includes three hotels and four restaurants and had a turnover of 40 billion levs in 1995, the Privatisation Agency said in a statement.
